image01.jpg.description:
the Venus of the painting the Birth of Venus by Sandro Botticelli.
Curiosity: Botticelli used Simonetta Vespucci as his muse for his Venus.

image02.jpg.description: Jesus Christ of the painting Salvator Mundi attributed in whole or in part to the Italian High Renaissance artist Leonardo da Vinci.

image03.jpg.description: the gentleman portrayed in Portrait of a gentleman, bust-length, in East India Company uniform painted by George Romney

image04.jpg.description:
Maja of the painting the Naked Maja (la maya desnuda), an oil on canvas painting of about 1797-1800 by the Spanish artist Francisco de Goya.
Curiosity: Goya created a pendant of the same woman identically posed, but clothed, known today as La maja vestida.

image05.jpg.description: A Commander in the East Indian Company of the homonymous painting by portrait and historical painter Mather Brown

image06.jpg.description: Pope Leo X portrayed by the High Renaissance painter and architect Raphael in the painting Portrait of Leo X.

image07.jpg.description:
Cecilia Gallerani, subject of the painting Lady with an Ermine, widely attributed to the Italian Renaissance artist Leonardo da Vinci.
Curiosity: it is the second of only four surviving portraits of women painted by Leonardo.

image09.jpg.description:
the girl, subject of the painting Girl with a Pearl Earring,an oil painting by Dutch Golden Age painter Johannes Vermeer.
Curiosity: the painting has been given various names over the centuries

image10.jpg.description: Bacchus, subject of the homonymous oil painting by Italian Baroque master Michelangelo Merisi da Caravaggio

image11.jpg.description:
Lisa del Giocondo, portrayed in the famous painting Mona Lisa by Leonardo da Vinci.
Curiosity: The Mona Lisa is one of the most valuable paintings in the world. It holds the Guinness World Record for the highest-known painting insurance valuation in history at US $ 100 million in 1962

image12.jpg.description: Frida Kahlo, in the Self Portrait with Bonito

image13.jpg.description:
Bacchus, subject of the Young Sick Bacchus by Italian Baroque master Michelangelo Merisi da Caravaggio.
Curiosity: the painting is also known as the Self-Portrait as Bacchus.

image14.jpg.description:
the daughter of the farmer in the painting American Gothic by Grant Wood.
Curiosity: American Gothic is one of the most familiar images of 20th-century American art and has been widely parodied in American popular culture.

image15.jpg.description:
the farmer in the painting American Gothic by Grant Wood.
Curiosity: American Gothic is one of the most familiar images of 20th-century American art and has been widely parodied in American popular culture.

image16.jpg.description: Euphrosina von Wilferstorf, wife of Jonas von Wilferstorf, portrayed by an unknown painter

image17.jpg.description: Joseph Benedikt Withalm, a master builder in Graz, subject of the portraid painted by Josef Schladerer.

image18.jpg.description: Jonas von Wilferstorf, an Austrian baron, portrayed by an unknown painter at the age of 26.

image19.jpg.description: Maria Anna Remschmidin from Graz, wife of Joseph Benedikt Withalm in a painting by Josef Schlanderer
